[h1]이 게임은 아직 묵은지마냥 묵혀놓는 게 맞다.[/h1]
[b]유저들의 기대감과는 별개로 인조이는 얼리엑세스 상태이니 만큼 생각보다 즐길 만한 컨텐츠도 많이 없고, 플레이 시 체감할 수 있는 문제점도 상당합니다. 그러나 사실상 해당 장르를 독점하고 있던 심즈의 대체제로 기대받는 만큼, 제작진이 업데이트만 꾸준히 지속해준다면 충분한 가능성이 있는 게임이라 여겨집니다.[/b]

본 리뷰에는 유사 장르 게임인 심즈와의 비교가 다수 존재합니다.

[h2]장점[/h2]

[b]그래픽이 뛰어남[/b] : 심즈3의 애매한 불쾌한 골짜기, 심즈4의 카툰 그래픽과 비교하였을 때 인조이의 그래픽은 비교 자체가 실례일 정도로 뛰어납니다. 레이트레이싱 기능을 켜면 이 장점은 배가 됩니다. 덕분에 단순히 길을 걸으며 주위를 둘러보는 것만으로도 눈이 즐거우며 예쁘고, 잘생긴 캐릭터와의 상호작용으로 충분한 만족감과 몰입감을 느낄 수 있었습니다. 특히나 커스터마이징, 건축을 즐기는 유저들은 이 장점이 무척이나 크게 느껴질 것입니다.

[b]흥미롭고 편리한 기능이 다수 존재[/b] : 수면, 식욕, 용변 등 캐릭터의 욕구불만이 있을 때 클릭 한 번으로 알아서 욕구를 해소할 수 있는 기능. 자동 세이브 기능. 편리한 마을 편집기능 등 모드를 설치하지 않은 기준에서도 불편함을 상당 수 해결해주는 기능들이 있습니다. 또한 모션 및 페이셜 캡처, 3D 오브젝트 제작기능, AI 디자인, WASD 키로 자신의 캐릭터나 차량을 직접 움직일 수 있는 기능처럼 유저들의 몰입감을 한껏 높여줄 만한 기능도 제법 존재하고 있습니다.


[h2]단점[/h2]

[b]판타지와 현실 사이의 애매한 경계[/b] : 개인적으로 가장 크게 느낀 단점. 현실 시뮬레이션이라고 생각하면 캐릭터들의 행동에서 어색한 부분이 너무 많고 [spoiler](ex. 대화 할 때마다 굳이 앉았다 일어났다 반복하는 행동, 굶어죽기 직전에도 꼭 요리 앞에서 박수친 뒤에야 식사를 시작하는 행동, 완성된 요리를 테이블 위에 두고 바로 먹는 것이 아니라 무조건 한 번 더 들었다 놓는 것 등.)[/spoiler] 판타지로서 생각하기에도 묘하게 현실성을 추구하려는 부분이 다수 보여 [spoiler](심즈와는 달리 텍스트 언어는 한글이나 영문 등 현실을 기반하고 있다는 점 등.)[/spoiler] 최종적으로는 이도저도 아닌 느낌이었습니다. 제작사가 어떤 방향을 추구하려는 건지는 모르겠지만 추후 업데이트를 이어가면서 한 쪽으로 확실하게 노선을 정했으면 합니다.

[b]이것저것 잡다한 것들을 많이 넣어두었지만 실속은 없음[/b] : AI의 지능을 향상시켜준다는 스마트 조이 기능은 되려 캐릭터들의 어색한 모습을 보여주면서 게임의 사양만 높이고, 카르마는 왜 존재하는지 모를 정도로 유저를 귀찮게 하는 시스템입니다. 일정 기능도 솔직히 꼭 필요한가 하면 저는 아니라고 여겨졌습니다. 새로운 시도는 좋지만 이와 같은 기능들이 긍정적인 결과를 불러낼지는 의문이 들었습니다.

[b]얼엑인 것을 감안해도 꽤 주요하다고 여겨지는 기능들이 없음[/b] : '전화 통화' , 배우자와의 데이트, 대화하고 있는 상대와 함께 다른 장소로 이동하는 기능 등. 아무리 얼리엑세스인 것을 감안해도 기본적인 기능이 다수 존재하지 않습니다. 특히 통화나 문자 대화 기능이 없어서 (발신은 없지만 수신 및 답장은 있음.) 친구, 연인과 상호작용하려면 무조건 눈앞에 불러야 한다는 점이 무척이나 짜쳤습니다.

[b]주요 목표의 부재. 이에 따른 몰입감의 급격한 저하[/b] : 나름 인생의 목표를 세울 수는 있지만, 달성이 어렵지도 않고 대단한 보상도 없으며 심지어 가끔 버그를 일으켜 목표 달성을 위한 카운팅이 되지 않는 경우도 많습니다. 따라서 인조이의 플레이 목적은 말 그대로 본인, 혹은 상호작용하는 캐릭터들에 애정을 갖고 그들의 삶과 죽음을 지켜보는 것 외에는 아직까지 다른 방도가 없습니다.

3. 도시관리 부분에서 카테고리와 설명간의 불일치로 인해 조절바를 올려야할지 내려야할지 헷갈리는 점은 개선되어야 할 부분이다. (예 : '화재예방률' 이라고 써놓고, 설명에는 '화재발생확률'에 영향을 준다 라고 써있음. 화재예방률이 높으면 화재가 덜 발생해야 하는것인데... 화재발생확률이 높아지는것인지 헷갈림.)

4. 건축 디자인을 좋아하는 유저에게는 매우 강추드린다. 현실적인 그래픽과, 현실적이고 한국적인 소품들이 매우 많아서 디테일을 살릴 수 있다. 다만, 가구를 설치할때 가끔 설치가 됐다가 안됐다가 하는 버그가 있음.

5. 전철타고 가는 장면을 보여준다던가, 차를 타고 자율주행이 가능하다던가...이런 부분이 생략되어 조금 아쉽다.

6. 조금만 대화하다보면 남자가 남자에게 뽀뽀하기 선택지가 뜨는 등 너무 쉽게 사랑에 빠지고(성 소수자 존중합니다.) 노인과 젊은 사람과의 로맨스가 너무 쉽게 설정되어있는 느낌이 있어 비현실적이라고 생각한다. 

7. 조이가 이동할때 가까운 문이 있음에도 굳이 멀리 있는 문으로 이동하는 문제가 있다. 이점은 꼭 개선되어야 할 부분.

8. 요리를 해서 먹거나 간편한 음식을 먹을때, 불필요한 동작이 너무 많다. 예를들면 음식을 만든 후 먹기를 누르면, 가까운 식탁에 음식을 놓아도 되는데, 굳이 멀리 있는 '특정' 장소까지 걸어가서 놓는다. 답답한 느낌이 든다.

9 위에 언급한 내용 외에는 나는 딱히 불편한 점을 느끼지 못했다. 충분히 잘만든 게임이고 심즈와 비교해도 손색없는 작품이라는 생각이 든다. 이번 데누보 사건때 게임사의 대처를 보면 유저들과의 소통을 중요하게 생각하는 만큼 앞으로의 발전이 더욱 기대된다.

아직 확장 중인 인생시뮬레이션 게임 외에도 커마와 건축이 충분히 재미있습니다. 게임 자체에서 느껴지는 부족한 점들은 아마 긴 시간을 거쳐서 채워갈 것이라는 걸 이 분야를 좋아하는 사람들은 알고 있어요. 매니아가 확실한 분야인 만큼 개발진과 유저들의 소통과 함께 합리적인 개선만 지속된다면 정말 오래갈 거예요. 심즈만 봐도 알 수 있죠. 인생시뮬레이션이란 장르답게 길게 봐야 더 갓겜.

딱 얼리어세스 수준임. 그래픽도 커마단계에선 훌륭하고 배경은 잘만들어두었으나. 인게임과 커마 캐릭간의 괴리감이 상당함. 
컨텐츠는 아직은 미적지근한 수준이며 아직 개발단계이므로 이건 이해할 수 있음. 다만 지속적인 업데이트로 컨텐츠가 추가되어야 할 것으로 보임.
최적화는 잘되어있으나, 최적화에 신경을써서 그런지 의외로 그래픽이 좋다는 느낌을 받진 못함. 
AI를 도입한 시도는 좋았으나 AI는 그다지 내가 원하는 만큼의 패턴 등을 만들어낼 수준의 학습이 이루어지지 않아보임. 디테일하게 설명해도 비스무리한 언저리의 것만 가지고 옴. 
여러 꾸밈 요소는 많으나 일단 기본적으로 조이들간의 상호작용의 인터페이스의 불편함과 함께 다양한 선택지는 있으나 실속없는 상호작용이 대부분. 관계를 이루어가는데 난이도가 너무 낮음. 전혀 다른 성향임에도 선택지만 상대 조이에 맞추면 어떠한 관계라도 긍정적으로 발전하기 쉬움. 그리고 카르마 시스템은 대체 뭘 말하고 싶은건지 모르겠지만 지속적으로 관리하라고 뜨는건 좀 아쉬운 부분임.

마지막 총평은 점수로 따지면 10점 만점에 6점 정도 주고싶은 정도의 얼리어세스 게임임. 수많은 얼리 억세스 특히 시뮬레이션 장르를 많이해봤지만 이 게임의 특별하거나 특출난 장점은 현재까지는 그래픽과 커마 밖에 없는 듯. 의상 제작이나 가구 제작등의 자유도가 더 필요하다고 느끼며 또한 인게임 내에서 수행할 수 있는 컨텐츠들이 더 필요하고 눈에 보이기만 하고 사용하지 못하는 맥도날드 같은 가게들이 추후에 업데이트 되어야 한다고 생각함. 직업도 물론 업데이트 되어야하고.
가장 중요한 심즈류의 게임에서의 돈의 가치에 대한 중요도가 너무 떨어짐. 초반에 자본 주는 것이 얼리 어세스라 그런지 몰라도 난이도가 너무 쉽게 설정되어버림. 결론은 아쉽지만 발전 가능성이 보이므로 지속 플레이 해보겠다 정도가 될 것 같음.

앞으로 컨텐츠가 엄청나게 나올 수 있기 때문에 무조건 해보고 가지고 계시는 걸 추천드림 .

Overall, I do not recommend this game in its current state. I did not have any huge issues with the game while playing, it is just boring and lacks character that can be found elsewhere, for cheaper!

The Good:
1) The character creator is fun and fleshed out. I had fun creating Zois in the demo and in the early access release. It has its downfalls, mainly surrounding weight, gender, and sexuality. I assume these will be mended in the future. 
2) In build mode, I love being able to customize furniture. I love being able to select different textures and any color from a color wheel.
3) The open world aspect is fun, but I have more to say about this in 'The Bad' section.
4) I like being able to customize the world with different trees, grass, and animals. The weather effects that you choose only last 1 in-game hour, though.

The Bad:
1) The game has an overall feeling of emptiness and lack of character. The things I thought my Zoi could interact with in the world were not interactable. It didn't feel like the world had a lot of Zois in it. It was a very lonely and bland experience walking around and trying to find stuff for my Zoi to do. She was able to get a boyfriend and go on a date very easily, but it still felt like a lonely experience. This is my main gripe with the open world.
2) The time that it takes to get through a whole day is agonizing. There is no good speed to select to skip through a day, either. You can select anything from 1x - 8x speed, but the game turns it up to 30x speed if your Zoi is sleeping and it's past 10 PM. I just want the 30x speed as an option at all times, since every other speed is teeth-grindingly slow. If I feel the need to go on my actual phone while playing this game to try to pass time in-game, that is a problem.
3) Active jobs are horribly boring. The Zois are given tasks that they do quickly and easily. Then, you have to repeat them 10 times in a shift. There were no Zois interacting with my Zoi while she was working. The job had no payoff and no satisfaction to it. Stick with non-active jobs if you play this game, for now.
4) There are plenty of QoL controls that are missing, which is expected. You have to turn on and off lights manually. You have to tell your Zoi to eat the food they just cooked. It is not easy to find out how to complete a 'want' of your Zoi. There are no hints as to what objects to interact with or where to look in the menus.
5) There are SO MANY MENUS. This is just a learning curve thing, and the menus will probably get cleaned up throughout development but holy moly. Be ready.
6) I ran the game on Ultra settings. There was stuttering for me, but I didn't mind that. The game did not look like it was running on ultra settings. Realistic graphics should NOT be a reason to buy this game.

Inzoi Early Access Review

Inzoi is a visually stunning game with a lot of potential. The Zoi creation and build mode are beautifully designed, offering an impressive range of customization options and innovative features that set the game apart. The animations, particularly for cooking and washing dishes, are fluid and realistic, adding depth to the experience. The urge system is also a unique feature that encourages players to interact with their Zois in new ways. However, despite these strong points, the game is nearly unplayable in its current state due to major bugs and glitches.  

Basic interactions are riddled with issues—my Zoi couldn’t make a simple salad without it disappearing into the counter, and she refused to eat a hotdog from the stand, instead walking in the opposite direction. The walking animations are painfully slow, which is frustrating when my Zoi constantly expresses irritation about wasting time—because she really is! The pathfinding system needs serious improvements, as Zois frequently wander aimlessly or take inefficient routes. The job system is also broken; when I tried to send my Zoi to work, she got into a cab that remained motionless for nearly 40 seconds. After canceling the interaction, her entire work schedule disappeared. Taking the bus didn’t help either, as I couldn’t even find the job location on the map.  

The dating system is equally frustrating. I was finally able to go on a date, but after a painfully slow walk to the bus and a trip to Town Square, my Zoi and her date arrived, only for him to immediately turn around and leave on the bus—so much for a romantic outing! While the animations are generally beautiful, some, like foot scratching and looking around constantly while walking, already feel repetitive. Conversations also lack clarity, making it difficult to tell how an interaction is progressing. To make matters worse, random Zois tend to join in even when I’m trying to have a private conversation with someone specific.  

The urge system, while an interesting mechanic, could use some refinement. My newly created Zoi suddenly wanted to show off her trophies—even though she didn’t have any! I later realized there was a trophy in the apartment I could interact with, but by the time I figured it out, the urge had already expired. A small hint system would make these interactions more intuitive. Additionally, the game lacks proper guidance, and a better tutorial would go a long way in helping players navigate its features.  

Overall, Inzoi has incredible potential, but in its current early access state, it’s difficult to enjoy due to the overwhelming number of game-breaking bugs and frustrating mechanics. The visuals, animations, and customization options are impressive, but until major updates address these issues, it’s hard to fully dive into the experience. I truly hope to see improvements in future patches because this game could be something special with the right fixes.

I understand this game is still in early access, but as it stands, it feels a bit lackluster. The core gameplay loop offers the basics: create your character, buy/build a home, and complete simple tasks—things that are often found in similar simulation or life-simulation games. However, beyond that, the experience feels rather shallow and lacks the depth to keep you fully engaged for long stretches.

The interactions, while present, are limited and can feel repetitive. For example, despite the game’s premise, there’s little incentive to explore deeper relationships or dynamic character interactions. Tasks also seem pretty basic, and there isn’t enough variety or fluidity in the systems to make daily life in the game exciting or engaging. The foundation is there, but there’s not enough features to really bring it to life.

Another issue I have is the lack of ambient noise. The environment itself is quiet, and it would be a nice touch to have more sounds or activities that make the world feel alive—whether it's conversations between NPCs, town noises, or the simple hum of daily life. Right now, it feels like something is missing in that regard.

Additionally, the game has some oddities. I was unsure how to escape jail, unsure why certain in-game interactions turn awkward or angry. It’s unclear whether this is a bug or just part of the game's design, but it leaves you feeling lost at times. This could easily be improved with more intuitive mechanics and clearer explanations of certain systems.

There’s certainly potential here, but I hope the developers can focus on making the world feel more interactive, smooth, and engaging. With a little more attention to the details and an expanded scope of activities and character interactions, this could become something great. For now, it’s a decent starting point, I’m hoping for a lot more in future updates.

I guess I'll start by saying I don't hate the game. Everything about it right now screams to me that there's no reason it won't be the best game in this genre. But I really couldn't recommend it at the moment unless you're a huge Sims fan.
It feels very much like the sims. But it's basically like the Sims 4 minus all the DLCs, and then minus a little bit more. Bring the graphics up to somewhere between modern and cutting edge, and completely ditch the cartoon style. Then add a few features that are completely different from Sim-like features, but leave them underdeveloped, lacking depth and polish. The game is early access, though, so underdeveloped features should be fully expected.

A few notable critiques:
- All of the interaction options are quite cumbersome. Any character interaction has a few different interaction "types" like you'd expect. But then within those categories, there's so many different interactions. Most of the interactions look to be generic, AI generated interactions that simply progress your relationship in whichever category. The interactions that aren't generic and actually lead to something cool don't stand out in any meaningful way.
- I met a woman, and within a few in game hours I was engaged to her. I was a little nervous about things moving too fast, so I called it a night and figured I'd pick up where we left off later. Only we didn't. I couldn't find her. She was lost in the massive city - lost to the sea of Zois. She was a contact in my phone, but I had no option to call her, no option to text her, no option to invite her over or invite her out. Maybe there is a way to meet up with Zois, but it wasn't anywhere I would think to look.
Relationships moved to fast, there's no navigating people's interests or saying things that might bore them; no penalties to the relationship unless you choose one of the mean interactions. Even if you establish a relationship, you'll probably not run into that Zoi again for a while, and there's no obvious way to arrange to meet them.
- There's a category of clothing labelled "CLO & MD". To most people this likely means nothing. But I'm quite familiar with Marvelous Designer and was excited at the prospect of importing custom made clothing into the game. It seems like a possibility, and is maybe planned for the future. But I didn't find any details on it other than a contest that the developers ran to get content creators to make clothing some time ago. This category should be removed, especially if there's no plans to implement CLO & MD imports.
- The camera controls are a bit frustrating. You can freely move the camera around detached from your Zoi, but you have to do it entirely with the mouse. I'd like to use WASD to move the camera without moving the Zoi. Of course I'd still like to move the Zoi with WASD as well, but I feel that should be something that can be toggled or only available in the over-shoulder view, not the top down view.
- My biggest critique is that there's seemingly no chaos. There's hints of chaos at a grand scale within the karma system. But on an individual level, day to day with my Zoi, I was free to do anything I wanted. There's no random occurrences to ruin any plans I make. Ultimately, there's no challenge. Live your life, fulfill your dreams, then eventually die.

I'll still be playing the game. Like I said, it probably will become the best game in the genre. There are certainly good things about it as well outside of the stunning graphics. But I'll only mention why I don't recommend it since there are many other reviews that do.

Finally, a worthy competitor to the Sims series!  There's still a long way to go, but it already does some things better than The Sims, and you don't have to spend thousands of dollars to enjoy it.
The character customization is incredible, giving you tons of options to make your sims feel truly unique. The world-building and interaction is fun, too.
That said, it’s not without its flaws. A lot of elements still missing (as expected with an early release), few minor bugs here and there and the AI behavior can feel a little repetitive at times, but hopefully, the devs will sort it out in future updates.
Overall, InZoi shows a lot of promise, and it's exciting to see where it goes. If you’re a fan of life sims, this one is definitely worth checking out.

Most places are strangely empty. You go to this tarot card-reading store, there's no one there. I just stole the money because why not, no one even seems to work here.

Relationships progress WAY TOO FAST, in one single afternoon my Zoi went from being strangers with a girl to being soul mates who are ready to marry each other. When you invite someone to a date, you can't even say goodbye to them - the other person just walks away, ending the date. It just looked hilarious when the girl suddenly ran off at full speed when the date ended.

Only the hunger bar and the sleep bar seems to matter. The energy bar, the cleanness, and the entire mood system barely affect the gameplay at all. Your Zoi is angry? They don't really act any different from usual. Your Zoi is out of university after a long day of classes? Your energy bar is somehow still 100%. Your Zoi should feel tired after long tasks, but they don't.

There are a lot of useless buttons in this game regarding conversations. Why can I tell someone I just met what I think about cryptocurrency? Why isn't this tied to your career, or your hobbies instead? Why does the game sometimes want me to suddenly be rude to another person in a way that feels so random. There's a button in the conversation wheel that says "Say you want a coffee break", but it's no different from the "Gossip" option - I thought your Zoi would invite the other person to coffee or something.

And one of my biggest issues is how multitasking seems to be almost impossible to do naturally in this game. My Zoi was visiting this store where this cute! girl was studying, sitting in a table. I make my Zoi get food and sit in front of her and talk to her, but the problem is that my Zoi just eats and then my Zoi and the girl have both to STAND from the table to greet each other.

Why?

Just make them greet each other while sitting!
